title: ABCI
body: ABCI is the Application BlockChain Interface, which acts as the API between the application and the consensus layer.

title: Atom
body: The Atom is the native staking currency of the Cosmos Hub. Validators use the Atom to stake and secure the zones within Cosmos.

title: BFT
body: BFT stands for Byzantine Fault-Tolerance. Byzantine faults within distributed systems are some of the most difficult to deal with. A Byzantine Fault-Tolerant consensus algorithm simply means that it can guarantee safety for up to a third of Byzantine, or malicious, actors.

title: Blockchain
body: Blockchain are deterministic state machines which act as mechanisms to synchronize data derived from a network of decentralized peers.

title: Cosmos
body: Cosmos is the network of blockchains which form the decentralized internet of tomorrow.

title: Cosmos Hub
body: The Cosmos Hub is a blockchain, but it's not just any blockchain; it's a custodial blockchain which keeps track of global invariants across other blockchains that are pegged to the hub, ensuring no double-spends across blockchains is possible.

title: Cosmo SDK
body: The Cosmos SDK is the bare bones SDK which gives you the framework for your specific blockchain-based application, allowing you to add functionality through plugins.

title: Cosmos Network
body: The Cosmos Nework is the network of blockchains interoperating within the Cosmos ecosystem.

title: Cosmos UI
body: The Cosmos UI is the UI for users to delegate, stake, engage in governance, and so on.

title: Delegator
body: Delegators are individuals with some amount of Atoms who stake their tokens with a validator, which can be thought of as a mining pool.

body: This problem is...

title: Elliptic Curve
body: In elliptic curve cryptography, a huge curve is generated, from which a public-private key-pair is derived. The chance of collision is 1 in several billions.

title: Ethermint
body: Ethermint is the EVM, stripped of PoW mining, built on top Tendermint with PoS instated.

title: Gaia
body: Gaia is what powers the Cosmos Hub. It is used as the testnet which serves to test the features of both Tendermint Core's and Cosmos' software stacks.

title: Governance
body: Blockchain governance is...

title: Hub
body: A Cosmos Hub is...

title: IBC
body: IBC is the interblockchain communication protocol which can be thought of as the TCP/IP for blockchains.

title: IBC packet
body: IBC packets are packets of data which carry messages and fraud proofs from one zone to the hub.

title: Lotion
body: Lotion is the developer toolkit which allows you to build blockchain applications on Tendermint in JavaScript.

title: Proof-of-Stake
body: Poof-of-Stake is a method of consensus in which uses the token itself to secure the network, which acts as a sort of virtualized ASIC, instead of using physical hardware to burn through electricity in order to do so.

title: Proof-of-Work
body: Proof-of-Work is a method of consensus in which uses hardware to burn through electricity in order to secure a decentralized network and mine blocks which form a blockchain.

title: Tendermint
body: Tendermint is a proposal mechanism and a state replication algorithm optimized for proof of stake. Tendermint is a swappable consensus engine, compatible for any blockchain application.

title: Zone
body: A Cosmos Zone is a blockchain spun up within the Cosmos Network.
